name: downward_surface_solar_radiation_glb_daily_mean
title: GL Model - Incident solar radiation on the surface (daily mean).
description: Solar radiation descending to the surface represents the solar energy incident on the Earth's surface. Various terms for this variable are found in the literature, including global solar radiation descending to the surface, where the term 'global' refers to total solar radiation, including direct radiation (arriving in line of sight from the solar disk) and diffuse radiation (solar radiation scattered by gases, clouds, and aerosols). Another term associated with its physical unit (W/m2) is global solar irradiance. The data are generated from instantaneous outputs inferred by the GL1.2 model and visible channel images from GOES satellites (GOES-10, GOES-12, GOES-13, GOES-16, GOES-19). For each day, the instantaneous images are integrated using the trapezoidal rule, and the final value is divided by 24 hours to represent the mean value for the day. Each daily data file is an image covering South America and the surrounding oceans. Each pixel in the image indicates the daily mean solar radiation.

providers.name: National Institute for Space Research (INPE)
providers.processing:lineage: The Solar Radiation Downward to the Surface (Daily mean) is generated from a modeling process that uses snapshots of the visible channel from GOES satellites as input to the GL1.2 Model. This process involves capturing a set of snapshots of solar radiation, from which the daily mean is calculated over a 24-hour period. The final image, which covers South America and the adjacent oceans, displays pixel values ​​representing this mean, expressed in Watts per square meter (W/m²).

bands.name: downward surface solar radiation
bands.description: Mean values ​​of global solar radiation descending to the surface over a day (24 hours). Radiation values ​​are inferred using the GL1.2 model and visible channel images from the geostationary satellite GOES.
